paper_metadata.title: Germline Mutations in Cancer Predisposition Genes are Frequent in Sporadic Sarcomas
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on BRCA2 variants, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: In the latter patient with UPS, sequencing of her tumor showed loss of heterozygosity of the BRCA2 variant, supporting the pathogenic prediction of this variant.

functional_data.summary: The BRCA2 variant is predicted to be pathogenic based on loss of heterozygosity observed in the tumor.

variants.additional_notes: This variant was found in a patient with a specific sarcoma phenotype.
key_quotes: In the latter patient with UPS, sequencing of her tumor showed loss of heterozygosity of the BRCA2 variant, supporting the pathogenic prediction of this variant.

tables_processed.table_caption: Predicted deleterious germline mutations across 10 genes identified from targeted genomic sequencing and digitalMLPA with clinical characteristics in the 9 patients.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for the BRCA2 variant was successfully extracted.
